pros: Working at the college opens up the opportunity to work with students and staff alike to engage and empower to pursue their degrees and certificates to become worthy members of the community.

pros: Understanding supervisors who will talk with you about your needs

pros: Nice environment to work in. The people makes the job highly fulfiling.

review_title: Great place to work, flexible schedule
pros: Great place to work, good benefits, public employee retirement, good people, very flexible schedule. Work with many great people from the community and in the organization. Job allows time to perform detailed research, explore, and master subject areas of expertise. Preparing people for real world jobs, and then working hard with industry partners to actually get students jobs after school/training is very fulfilling.
cons: Working with various individuals from the community can be very challenging. Large investment of time for prepping class materials in efforts to adapt to forever changing and varying learning styles. Must be on feet for prolonged periods, and must be able to speak up to 5 hours at a time for lecture. Additional time must be dedicated to ensure student life success.

review_title: AVCC serves a wonderful and diverse clientele.
pros: The faculty and staff are professional and caring, and  -- for the most part -- genuinely committed to serving the students, providing them with many pathways to a better life. The campus is an oasis inn the high desert - a pleasant and tree-shaded place with an amazing new dramatic arts complex.
cons: AVCC shares with any educational bureaucracy the shortcomings borne of lack of funding, interdepartmental squabbling.

review_title: Good organization, but not forward thinking
pros: It is a very secure job. All full time employees benefit from union contracts so good benefits, pay and leave time.
cons: Leadership is not forward thinking and can be old fashioned. Lets of union employees who never leave and can be difficult to work with. Part-time teachers and employees are not treated well.

pros: This is the best student job on campus It allows you to work on your own homework when slow and the hours that you work are those you say you are available.  This is the best resume builder and the people are the tutor overseers are very nice and easy going.
cons: It pays minimum and you cannot work more than 20 hours per week

pros: Working at AVC was such a blessing! The staffed understood school was first and work was second. Every semester they accommodated my school schedule.  I loved working here! The staff is extremely friendly and supportive.
cons: My only complaint was student workers are only allowed to work 20 hours per week.

pros: Friendly staff who are great when you are starting off. I am currently an adjunct instructor here and everyone has been great about helping me start my class.
cons: I don't have any cons about working for this company. They have been great to me so far.

pros: It is a good campus with excellent faculty...eager students, from the low-income area.
cons: The administration is bloated and out of touch. This problem isn't unique to AVC, and neither is the overloading of courses with adjunct while paying them pennies of what a full-time salary is.
